title: Richard Hillman returns to Coronation Street for Halloween
text:
Just when you thought it was safe in Coronation Street, serial killer Richard Hillman is set to stalk the cobbles once more this coming Halloween – and you can even meet him as Brian Capron reprises the iconic role.

The actor will be taking part in a special event with the Coronation Street Tour which will see some chilling and spooky features for visitors and also allow people to go trick or treating on the actual Street.

And Brian will be popping up in character as soap’s most infamous serial killer. We should have all stayed at the party…

He said: ‘I had some fantastic storylines during my time on Coronation Street. Richard was such a sinister and eerie character – I’ve certainly got some ghastly stories to share from his years of murderous crimes!’

Richard’s victims included Duggie Ferguson, who he left to die after a fall from badly made stairs as well as Patricia Hillman (the old spade to the face routine) and Maxine Peacock, who he murdered in her own home.

He also attempted to kill off Weatherfield legends Emily Bishop and Audrey Roberts before driving the Platt family into a canal but only managing to defeat himself in the process.

On the evening of Saturday 26 October, visitors to the Official Coronation Street tour can take part in a one-off special, including Trick or Treat on the nation’s favourite Street and a walking tour of scary storylines from the programme’s rich history.

As darkness descends, the Street will receive a spooky makeover complete with pumpkins and eerie lighting, plus there’ll be face painting, trick or treating and other delights for the whole family.

Halloween Tours will run for one night only from 6-9pm on Saturday 26 October. Tickets cost £25, children (aged 3 – 15 years old) £12.50 and under 3s go free.
